intro: Sonerila nudiscapa, commonly known as the naked-stemmed sonerila, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of New Guinea. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its slender, often leafless stems. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers with five petals, typically in shades of pink or red. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on trees or rocks. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is a sought-after species among plant collectors.
